ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] mid level armour questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Okies, here s some suggestions... Arms: Lambent Vambraces (ac 11, +2 vs all resistances, +1 cha) these simply can t be beat. I m not sure I d even take Imbrued
ygData.messageBody:
Okies, here's some suggestions...

Arms: Lambent Vambraces (ac 11, +2 vs all resistances, +1 cha) these simply
can't be beat. I'm not sure I'd even take Imbrued over them. (well, I'd take
em, cause they look great and are our planar armor) I would suggest heading
to sol a, getting a good group and hunting the bar. A good puller can pull
some solussek champions and you should see the fiery vambraces. then make
another group and kick choon and froon's ass.

Boots: again, go with the lambent. (same stats as the vambraces) These are a
little tougher to get, but way easier than getting DWB. the firewalker boots
come from solussek mages which are in the slightly tougher area near the
king in sol a. With a strong group though, you can get them.

Chest: go with bronze, much cheaper than steel and same ac. the down side is
it's ugly. If you can't stand the hideous bronze color, then I suggest
charred. (ac 16, +3 str, +6 sta) Charred should still cost way less than
steel (average on the tribunal server is 600-800 p)

Head: Skull shaped Barbute (ac 13, +35 hp, +10 vs magic) hands down one of
the best pieces of headgear in the game. average price on tribunal is
300-500 p.

Wrist: Lambent Bracers (ac 9, +4 str, +1 cha) you can take griffenes solo
I'd think (although you may need to kite them a while) as for the dark boned
bracelet, shouldn't be too hard to get in a group in unrest. ac can't be
beat on these. the other viable option IMO is symbol of loyalty to vox (ac
7, +7 vs cold, weight 0.3) these usually cost less than silver plated and I
find the +vs cold to be more useful than the +vs poison and disease)

Hands and Leggings: I suggest going with shin. it's no drop and it seems
that players are generally more than happy to give you the looting rights.
they also drop very near the zone to upper guk, so getting them doesn't
present much danger. I suggest bringing some extra food and some plat so you
can play banker, the campers will definitely appreciate you if you do.

good luck. = )

Draelon Stormsong
Bard of the Tribunal

-----Original Message-----
From: Elijah Meeker [mailto:elijah@...]
Sent: Tuesday, March 21, 2000 12:54 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] mid level armour questions


From: "Elijah Meeker" <elijah@...>

I just made 26 and couldn't train Instil Doubt in Freeport (though it was
late I was tired and I think I didn't check the other guildmaster), no
biggie, I need to go to Kelethin to buy Screech anyway.

So, just want to make sure that I am headed in the right direction, based on
what I am reading on this list I am selling my stat boosting items that take
me over 100 and replacing them with AC, I also traded my Kobold Hide boots
for a Staff of Writhing (I know, it won't proc for two more levels but it is
better than my polished granite Tomahawk). The charisma hit was no fun, it
takes me to 98 chr, but I will probably strade a +3str earing for a +?
charisma earing and be fine.

I have about 400pp now (though barefoot :o) still have to sell the PGT, and
trying to decide on armour choices, I can't play a lot, and when I do will
probably solo, so my money situation is not going to skyrocket, here are my
partially informed ideas, all suggestions are very welcome.

Arms:
Keeping my Barbed Armplates: (AC 7. +2 Dexterity), Steel Vambraces: (AC 8)
only get me 1 AC

Back:
Figure I will keep my Lizardscale Cloak: (AC 8 + 5 to Dexterity), at level
17 I did comedy standup (died once, lizzies do NOT get social commentary
humor) for about 2 hours at Cazic Zone until someone sold me it for 80pp. I
think I made a third of that banking at the same time.

Chest:
I still have a Dwarven Ringmail Tunic: (AC 12, +8 to heat, cold and magic
protection.) which frankly is still nice for pulling with it's resists..but
that AC hit is hurting...so, not having 1kpp for a Brigandine Tunic (and
however much for a Mithril) I am thinking Steel Breastplate (AC 17)

Face:
Until my dream of a Mask of Deception dreams come true I am going to stick
with my bronze mask, I don't see a huge benefit to steel

Feet:
Of course I would love Dwarven Work Boots: (AC 8 STR+3, DEX+5) but though I
have no idea what they go for I am guessing it is too rich for my blood, so
Steel Boots (AC 8) seems the thing.

Hands:
Gah, I love my Elf Hide Gloves (I checked, it is no one I know :o) (AC 4. +5
desterity, +5 Agility) but if I can keep my dex and agi above 100 I am going
to go for Plate gauntlets (AC 9), or, I suppose, if they don't cost a
fortune Shin Gauntlets ( AC 7. +5 poison)

Head:
I have a Blackened Iron Crown (AC 5. +5 Strength, and +5 each to poison,
fire, cold, disease and magic resistances) but am thinking I would start
saving for the (Crested Helm: AC 10. +6 st, +3 char) or at least a Fine Silk
Turban (AC 10, SV Fire +10) though, and I know this places me in the extreme
minority, I *like* the Bird-Head look of a metal helm on a Wood Elf. There
is also a Griffon Helm (AC 10. +9 str, +5 agil).

Legs:
I am thinking of keeping my Barbed Legplates (AC 8. +2 Agility) until I can
get Silver-Plated Leggings (AC 10. +3 strength, +5 agility)

Neck:
Ack, finally goingto give up that Spiked Collar (AC 3. +3 to Strength) and
go with a Steel Collar (AC 6)

Shoulders:
Love the Bloodstained Mantle: (AC 6. +3 to strength, +10 magic protection)
and I am rueing the day I sold the Crested Spaulders (AC 11, +6 stamina) I
had bought for *80pp* of a hurried fellow in Freeport bank.

Waist:
Sticking with the Thick Leather Apron(AC 8), at 26 I figure the Thick Banded
Belt:(AC 8, +15 strength) is a looong way away.

Wrist:
I have one Silver Plated Bracers (AC 7 +5 disease resistance, +5 poison
resistance) I figure I need another. No real contenders here...

Weapons:
Finally, to replace my Dragoon Dirk I will start looking for an Obsidian
Shard (Damage 6, Delay 25, Effect of Obsidian Shatter)


With jewlery this should dramatically raise my AC and keep my stats all
around 100. Am I correct in thinking that this is the best approach at 26?
Any hints on prices would be greatly appreciated, and would make a lot of
people on Povar happy because I wouldn't keep offering to trade them a 350pp
item for a 1-2Kpp item *laughs* criminy that is embarassing :o)


Thanks in advance for any replies, I greatly appreciate it.

Tszaaz E'Taurguin

P.S. Has there ever been any sort of mention why at level 26 you get both
Screech and Instill Doubt? Was it just bad planning and they figured the
lesser of all evils was to give them at the same level? Seems odd...
